sub_title: MA graduate from the International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam, Major in Local Economic Development/Strategies

school.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

company.name: Ministry of Local Government and rural development, Ghana

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Local Government and rural development, Ghana
profile_positions.description:
As a Development Planning Officer (DPO),  the main aim was to promote local governance at the local levels to realize government’s decentralization programme in Ghana. I have worked in the Bosomtwe, Amansie South and Asokwa Municipal assemblies to promote decentralization and local governance for development.  

Tasks included Preparation of Medium-Term Development Plan (MTDP) for the Assemblies, preparation, and implementation of composite annual action plans, conducting monitoring and evaluation of development projects, secretary to the District/Municipal coordinating unit (D/MPCU) and to ensure that quarterly reports were prepared. 

Again, I had the opportunity to work with GIZ and the Ghana Secondary Cities Support Program (GSCSP) as municipal secretary to these projects as beneficiary municipal assembly.

Through hard work and dedication, District/Municipal Annual Plans, Progress reports and other reports were prepared and submitted to the Regional Coordinating Council (RCC) and National Development Planning Commission (NDPC) whiles other projects executed as planned.
profile_positions.title: Development Planner

company.name: World University Service of Canada (WUSC - EUMC)

profile_positions.company: World University Service of Canada (WUSC - EUMC)
profile_positions.description:
On this project, my tasks carried out included ensuring that beneficiary communities through their opinion leaders embraced the development of their communities in the areas of water and sanitation, promote their school systems through strengthening the Parent Teacher Associations (PTAs), School Management Committees (SMCs) and youth development. The aim was to promote community development but using local resources and the local people to realize development and own it by themselves. Thus, 
•	Participatory Learning and Action (PLA) was used in data collection on communities
•	Community Action Plans (CAPs) were prepared with community members
•	Water and Sanitation issues were improved
•	Boys and Girls clubs were created especially in schools

Through hard work and dedication, Communities were able to prepare and implement their own communities Action Plans, Boys and Girls clubs were formed and trained, SMCs and PTAs strengthened, and various workshops were well organized and carried out.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Project Officer

profile_positions.location: Accra, Greater Accra Region, Ghana, Kumasi Ghana and Tamale, Ghana
profile_positions.description:
Designed programs for volunteers from their arrival into Ghana, integration with host families and work at their project sites. 
Mentored volunteers and gave an introductory orientation
Resolved volunteers' issues with host families and also at project sites
Regular monitoring of volunteer activities through field visits and reporting
Ensured smooth running of the program with diaspora partners by updating the program database for easy tracking of each country's volunteers' activities and well-being.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Program Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Transferred data from paper to computer files (EQUAL's database)
•	Checked for accuracy and corrected all incompatibilities.

•	Responded to queries and acted appropriately

•	Keyed appropriate information against each beneficiary school
•	Managed and filed raw data collected for future reference
